supporting_text: The NAP includes specific goals for reducing antibiotic use in humans and improving prescribing practices.
The NAP outlines goals for reducing antibiotic use in food-producing animals and monitoring antibiotic resistance in animal populations.
The NAP includes goals for mapping antibiotic-resistant bacteria in various environments and studying the effects of other drivers of resistance.
The NAP addresses antibiotic use in agriculture, particularly in food-producing animals and the need for responsible practices.
The NAP mentions the establishment of an interdepartmental working group to follow up on the implementation of the strategy.
The NAP sets specific targets for reducing antibiotic use in humans and animals by 2020.
The document states that measures are limited to those that can be implemented within applicable budget frameworks.
The NAP mentions the continuation of an interdepartmental working group to coordinate efforts against antibiotic resistance.
The NAP emphasizes the need for improved understanding and competence regarding antibiotic use among prescribers and the general population.
The NAP includes plans for mass media campaigns to educate the public about appropriate antibiotic use.
The NAP outlines the importance of international cooperation and collaboration with WHO, FAO, and OIE.
The NAP discusses the need for mapping antibiotic-resistant bacteria and improving monitoring systems.
The NAP emphasizes the need for improved monitoring and analysis of antibiotic resistance incidences.
The NAP includes goals for improved infection control measures in healthcare settings.
The NAP mentions the need for compliance with international standards and guidelines related to antibiotic use.
The NAP discusses the importance of improving prescribing practices and monitoring antibiotic prescriptions.
The NAP emphasizes the need for a strong legislative framework to regulate antibiotic use.
The NAP includes goals for ensuring appropriate use of antibiotics across all sectors.
The NAP mentions participation in international research collaborations to develop new antibiotics and diagnostic methods.
